Detailed Description

Sprites are display classes for handling dynamic game objects like creatures.

Each sprite contains a set of Animation instances, and tracks the "parent object's" locations as of the last two physics updates so that drawing can smoothly interpolate between those points.

def sprite.Sprite.draw (   self,
  screen,
  camera,
  progress,
  drawLoc = None,
  scale = 1 
)

Draw the current animation frame.

Parameters:
drawLoc The location to draw the sprite. This is optional; if it is not provided, then the sprite will derive its own draw location based on its locations at the previous two physics updates.

def sprite.Sprite.getCurrentAnimation (   self,
  shouldIncludeFacing = False 
)

Return the current animation, defaulting to not including the facing if any.

Todo:
Assumes that the facing is the last two characters of the string. Probably a better way to handle this.

def sprite.Sprite.getDrawLoc (   self,
  progress 
)

Interpolate between self.prevLoc and self.curLoc, using progress to weight the two locations.

Round drawing locations to the nearest hundred-thousandth to prevent visual jittering caused by very minor positional variation.

def sprite.Sprite.getPolygon (   self,
  shouldUsePrevAnimation = False 
)

Retrieve the current animation's polygon, or the previous animation's polygon if needed.

def sprite.Sprite.resetAnimation (   self  ) 

Reset the currently-running animation.

def sprite.Sprite.setAnimation (   self,
  action,
  shouldUseFacing = True,
  shouldResetAnimation = True 
)

Set the current animation for the sprite.

Parameters:
shouldUseFacing If true, the actual animation name used has -l or -r appended, depending on self.owner.facing
shouldResetAnimation If true, the frame of the animation is reset; otherwise it is preserved.
Todo:
shouldResetAnimation should be handled better. Currently we need it so we can "try out" different polygons for collision detection (c.f. TerrestrialObject crawl logic) without interfering with smooth animation.

def sprite.Sprite.setPreviousAnimation (   self,
  shouldResetAnimation = True 
)

Set the current animation to what the previous one was.

def sprite.Sprite.update (   self,
  loc = None 
)

Update the displayed animation.

If the animation has finished, apply whatever closing logic is necessary.

Parameters:
loc The location of the sprite as of this update. This is technically optional if you are going to specify a drawing location every time you call Sprite.draw().
